titles.title: Osomatsu-kun (1988)
おそ松くん(新)
Cosas de locos!! ¡Esto es lo que hay!
おそ松くん (1988)
Cosas de locos!!
Cousas de Tolos

relatedanime.anime: Osomatsu-kun: Suika no Hoshi kara Konnichiwa zansu!
Bakabon Osomatsu no Curry wo Tazunete Sansenri

anime.description: * Remake of the classic gag comic with the same name by http://anidb.net/cr977 [Akatsuka Fujio]. The leading character is a boy named http://anidb.net/ch37177 [Osomatsu], who is one of sextuplets. This zany comedy features such eccentric and over-the-top characters as bucktoothed French-styled Iymi, bald boy http://anidb.net/ch37183 [Chibita], big-pants http://anidb.net/ch37184 [Dekapan], self-absorbed cutie http://anidb.net/ch37192 [Totoko], and many others. Together they create many topsy-turvy confusions in the town.

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: talking animal
tag.description: Talking animals are a common theme in mythology and folk tales, as well as children`s literature. Fictional talking creatures often are anthropomorphic, possessing human-like qualities but appearing as a creature. An animal that only knows how to say its name (for example, 99.9% of all http://anidb.net/t2493 [Pokemon]), are not talking animals.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: gunfights
tag.description: Fights where two or more parties are firing guns at one another.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: sudden naked guy appearance
tag.description: A male specimen previously unknown to the viewer and not dressed in any clothes suddenly appears out of nowhere.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: bloodless wounds
tag.description: No matter what weapon is used in what way to attack, hurt or kill somebody, there won`t be blood. You may see ripped clothes and smoke coming from the deadly wounds, but that`s it. So if you have an aversion towards the red liquid but still love some action going on - this is the anime for you!

tag.name: body exchange
tag.description: Two or more characters swap bodies (or, equally, swap minds). When this plot is done, usually the voices also switch as narrative cheat to help viewers keep track of who`s who. More subtly, it`s just the eyes. More serious/action-oriented shows might not do this. The Flip often involves characters of different ages, genders, races, or social classes. Another variation is a protagonist and antagonist switching, which usually involves each trying to undermine the other`s organization while simultaneously trying to switch back. If one or both of the characters have superpowers or other special abilities, they`ll have a lot of trouble figuring their new powers out.

tag.name: self-parody
tag.description: The anime is a parody of itself. I.e. the authors make fun of the genre they are portraying, and take the actions of their characters and story lightly.

tag.name: butchered foreign languages
tag.description: In this anime, some characters "speak" foreign languages, successfully making the audience`s ears bleed. That is especially true if the viewer is a native speaker of or otherwise proficient in the languages in question. The foreigners in the show do not seem to take much notice of the fact that their supposed native languages are being massacred. In fact, oftentimes they also actively participate in the butchering of said languages. That happens, of course, because they, too, are voiced by Japanese people without knowledge of the language they`re supposed to speak, or to pretend to speak at any rate.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: body and host
tag.description: When a foreign entity like that of a symbiote, body snatcher, puppeteer parasite, or even a hacker (when regarding machines like robots and computers) enters/outright hijacks a body, the possessed subject becomes what is usually called: the host. The basic purpose of the host varies on what the point was for it to have been hijacked in the first place. Sometimes it`s used as a disguise, other times it`s used as a decoy and destraction, even simply being used as a weapon and piece of armor that the possessor uses to cause sheer chaos and destruction, but sometimes... a host can be used for fetish fuel.

tag.name: sexual abuse
tag.description: Sexual abuse is the act of one person forcing sexual activities upon another. Sexual abuse includes not only physical coercion and sexual assault, especially rape, but also psychological abuse, such as verbal sexual behaviour or stalking, including emotional manipulation.

tag.name: groping
tag.description: Groping is the act of subjecting another person to unwanted sexual touching.

character.name: Rerere no Ojisan
character.description: The Bakabon family`s odd neighbor, named so for his tendency to say Rerere (rather than are (あれ)) when confused about the countless shenanigans in the series. He is almost always seen sweeping the street outside of his yard. He is bald, has a moustache but no nose, ears that extend slightly off of his head, and wears a yukata and geta sandals. Source: Wikipedia

episode.title: シェーッ! 六つ子ザンス!
Sheee! The Sextuplets-zansu!
¡Shiee! Los sextillizos
episode.summary: Failing salesman Iyami tries robbing Osomatsu`s house, but is foiled by the rambunctious sextuplets. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: うらないは, こりごりザンス
I`ve Had It with Fortune-telling-zansu!
episode.summary: A fortune-teller tells Iyami that three terrible things are going to happen to him that day. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天才イヤミの 化け薬ザンス!
Genius Iyami`s Transformation Potion-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami, a quack doctor in a small town, schemes to discredit his more successful rival. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シェ~ッ!! ミーはバレリーナ
Sheee! I`m a Ballerina!
episode.summary: Iyami`s ballet school is putting on a performance in three days, but amid backstage turmoil, the prima ballerina keeps changing.Chibita falls in love with Dekapan`s "daughter," Hanako, unaware that she`s actually a pig. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太の恋は ハナと散るダス
Chibita`s Love Falls with the Flowers
episode.summary: Chibita falls in love with Dekapan`s "daughter," Hanako, unaware that she`s actually a pig. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ナンマイダで もうけるザンス
Profiting from Death Prayers-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami fakes his own death in order to collect consolation money. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太は ママになりました
Chibita Becomes a Mama!
episode.summary: Chibita secretly takes care of an abandoned baby. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 変身! チビ太の ふしぎな帽子
Transformation! Chibita`s Amazing Hat!
episode.summary: Chibita gets a hat that turns him into a good boy when he wears it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 古道具屋で ボロもうけザンス
Making Easy Money with a Secondhand Store-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami and Chibita are deceptive secondhand item dealers who are aiming for one big score. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地獄の 死神セールスマン!!
Shinigami Salesman From Hell!
episode.summary: A Shinigami enlists Iyami`s help to hasten the death of a sickly Osomatsu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヘイの中でも こりないイヤミ
Even Behind Bars, Iyami Never Learns!
episode.summary: Iyami and Chibita are handcuffed together and on the run from the law after breaking out of jail. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 売れっ子小説家 イヤミ大先生
The Great Iyami-sensei, the Popular Author!
episode.summary: Iyami is a failed novelist who becomes popular when he starts writing outrageous lies about his neighbors. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お城が隣に 引っ越してきた!
A Castle Moved In Next Door!
episode.summary: When an Edo-era castle suddenly comes to town, the local citizens rebel against their would-be ruler, Chibita. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エイリアンを やっつけろ!
Beat the Aliens!
episode.summary: Aliens intent on invading Earth kidnap Osomatsu and Choromatsu, then replace them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 命の恩は 高くつくザンス
Getting Your Life Saved is Expensive-zansu!
episode.summary: After Iyami saves Osomatsu`s life, he demands constant, eternal gratitude. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 節約? 省エネ? ミニ六つ子!
Saving? Energy Conservation? Mini-sextuplets!
episode.summary: Chibita uses a secret formula to shrink Osomatsu and his brothers as payback for mocking him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハタ坊, 勇気を出す
Hatabou Musters Up Courage.
episode.summary: Hatabou must summon courage to stand up for himself after being jailed for one of Iyami`s misdeeds. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太の 金庫やぶり
Chibita the Safecracker!
episode.summary: Chibita is a former safecracker who`s trying to go straight, but a detective, Iyami, keeps hounding him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: オツムの中味が 入れかわる
Switched Psyches!
episode.summary: Dr. Dekapan invents a liquid that causes people to switch psyches when they bump heads. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの アブナイ時計屋さん
Iyami, The Dangerous Watch Dealer!
episode.summary: Iyami and Chibita build a watermelon bomb to get revenge against Osomatsu and his brothers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 友情!! チビ太とドロボウ猫
Friendship! Chibita and the Cat Thief!
episode.summary: Kindhearted newspaper delivery boy Chibita takes in a thieving cat and tries to rehabilitate it. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太は さすらいのガンマン
Chibita is a Wandering Gunslinger
episode.summary: A mysterious gunslinger, Chibita, shows up at the Dekapan Ranch just in time to drive off six bullying brothers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 名探偵! ハタ坊だジョー
The Great Detective! Hatabou-da jou!
episode.summary: When Osomatsu and the gang are invited for dinner at Iyami`s posh mansion, a mystery ensues. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの体は バイキンだらけ
Iyami`s Body is Full of Germs!
episode.summary: Totoko becomes infected with personality-altering bacteria from Iyami`s body. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おでんの恨みは 怖いザンス!
The Curse of Oden is Scary-zansu!
episode.summary: Chibita is framed for stealing oden. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 父さんも タバコがやめられる
Dad Can Quit Smoking.
episode.summary: Dad struggles with quitting smoking after he nearly starts a fire in the house. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おとぎ話の デベソ島
The Fairy Tale of Outie Island!
episode.summary: On Outie Island, Dekapan and Hatabou work hard to make offerings to a stone god, while Iyami and everyone else enjoys the good life. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 野生のイヤミに 気をつけろ!
Watch Out for Wild Iyami!
episode.summary: When the sextuplets and Totoko go camping, they encounter Iyami, a wild man of the forest. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 保険屋さんは 命がけザンス!
It`s Do or Die for an Insurance Agent!
episode.summary: Iyami starts an insurance company, thinking he`ll take people`s money and run. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忍者チビ太, ただいま参上!
Ninja Chibita is Here!
episode.summary: Chibita comes back to town seeking vengeance after training in the mountains to be a ninja. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 花の精には こりごりザンス!
Up to Here with the Spirit of the Flower-zansu!
episode.summary: The honest, hardworking Chibita is constantly targeted by the lazy thief, Iyami, but one day he finds a magical rose that changes his life. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トト子は アイドルNo.1ザンス
Totoko is the Number One Idol-zansu!
episode.summary: When a pretty girl moves next door to Osomatsu and his brothers, Totoko is deposed as the neighborhood`s number one idol. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男の友情は あついザンス!
Male Friendship is Hot-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami and Chibita are best friends and trapeze artists at a third-rate circus, but Totoko, the ringmaster`s daughter, comes between them. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 父さんは, 父さんなんだぞ!
Dad is Dad!
episode.summary: Exhausted and feeling unloved by his six sons, Dad runs away from home and pledges to raise fellow runaway Chibita. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: デカパン城の オテンバ姫!
The Tomboy Princess of Dekapan Castle!
episode.summary: In the Edo era, Minister Iyami secretly plots to have Princess Totoko assassinated so his own son, Hatabou, can take the reins of power. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正義の味方は つらいザンス
It`s Tough Being a Champion of Justice-zansu!
episode.summary: Oden Chibita X fights for love, justice and truth, but then Buck Teeth Man gets in on the act and steals his thunder. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太の宝島
Chibita`s Treasure Island.
episode.summary: Chibita sets off for adventure with his grandfather`s treasure map in hand, but is soon captured by pirates. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お年寄りを いたわるザンス!
Be Kind to the Elderly-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami and Chibita pose as a poor elderly couple in order to sponge off of Osomatsu`s family. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 討ち入りには, ご用心ザンス
Take Caution During a Raid-zansu!
episode.summary: After feudal lord Hatabou is forced into committing seppuku, his loyal retainers, led by Chibita, plot revenge against the power-hungry Iyami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 子守りは つらい仕事ザンス
Babysitting is Hard Work-zansu!"
episode.summary: Osomatsu and his brothers are forced to babysit their dad`s boss`s violent, insomniac son. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 摩天楼の ホワイトクリスマス
White Christmas of the Skyline.
episode.summary: Chibita is a bellboy working at the Dayon Hotel when he takes in Totoko, a poor girl who`s lost her beautiful singing voice. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの インチキ商売ザンス
Iyami`s Shifty Business!
episode.summary: Chibita becomes apprentice to Iyami, a small-time con man, but their plans go awry when they swindle, Dayon, an off-duty police officer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レースは ズルして勝つザンス
Win the Race by Cheating-zansu!
episode.summary: The usual gang competes in a wacky car race to sweep the wealthy Totoko off her feet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの デタラメ日本ザンス
Iyami`s Gibberish Japan-zansu!
episode.summary: French director Iyami and his cameraman Chibita travel to Japan to film a documentary on the "real Japan." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スキー旅行は チビチイザンス
Ski Trips Are Tough-zansu!"
episode.summary: Pretending to be a ski instructor, Iyami goes to a resort with Osomatsu and his brothers, but runs afoul of Chibita, a former co-worker with a grudge. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ねっけつ! チビ太刑事ザンス
The Hot-blooded Detective Chibita-zansu!
episode.summary: Detective Chibita is transferred to a town where oden is prohibited, but is sold in a black market controlled by a shady character. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宝くじで 大金持ちザンス!
Wealthy from the Lottery-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami is stunned to find he`s won a lottery jacpot on a ticket he made his pal Chibita purchase a year earlier, but only has one day left to collect. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゼン寺修行で 六つ子もよい子
The Boys Learn Manners at a Zen Temple!
episode.summary: Osomatsu and his brothers are sent to a zen temple to be straightened out by Iyami, a monk who`s in it for the money. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お巡りさんで いばるザンス!
The Arrogant Police Officer-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami is a crooked police officer who plays pachinko, steals fruit and tries to pick up women while he`s on duty. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐竜たまごの オムレツザンス!
Dinosaur Egg Omelet-zansu!"
episode.summary: In the primitive age, Chibita is a cook at Iyami`s dinosaur egg omelet restaurant when he finds a baby T-rex that he wants to keep as a pet. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 旅のハジは かきすてザンス!
What Happens at the Inn Stays at the Inn-zansu!
episode.summary: Osomatsu and his family stay at a cheap inn while on vacation, but realize too late that it`s actually an extrememly expensive place way beyond their budget. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正しいイヤミは めいわくダス
An Honest Iyami is Dangerous!
episode.summary: Dr. Hatabou creates an explosive lie detector belt for inveterate liar Iyami, which painfully straightens out the con artist, but that causes even more chaos. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゴマすりゴルフで 出世ザンス
Brown-nosing with Golf-zansu!
episode.summary: When Iyami and the sextuplets` father are both up for an important promotion, the president has his son, Chibita, decide who it`ll be after playing golf with Iyami and Osomatsu. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミさんの 結婚式だジョー
Iyami-san`s Wedding!
episode.summary: Poverty-stricken Iyami falls for a beautiful, wealthy young woman who feels the same way about him, except she has no idea just how poor he is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドライブしたのが ウンのつき
Luck Ran Out on the Drive.
episode.summary: Dad and the boys have major troubles when they encounter Iyami while on the road in their "new" decrepit used car. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大富豪 チビ太さまザンス!
The Super-rich Chibita-sama-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami has a hard time trying to change all the restaurants in town to oden joints in order to please the mega-rich Chibita. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの ヒコーキ野郎ザンス
That Bastard Pilot, Iyami-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami pilots a rickety plane to Hawaii, but it gets hijacked en route. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: シェ~! こずかい毎日五万円
Sheee! A 50,000 Yen a Day Allowance!
episode.summary: Osomatsu is adopted by the wealthy Dekapan and his wife, but finds them to be overprotective, to say the least. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハタ坊は 正義の味方だジョー
Hatabou is a Champion of Justice-dajou!
episode.summary: Presidential candidate Iyami hires hitman Jou Hatabou to take out his rival, Dayon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 空とぶチビ太の 仕返しザンス
The Revenge of Flying Chibita-zansu!
episode.summary: Chibita and Iyami take revenge against the bullying Osomatsu and his brothers via remote-controlled model airplanes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おでんと初恋 どちらがだいじ
Which is More Important, Oden or Your First Love?
episode.summary: Chibita is smitten with Jajako, Hatabou`s cousin, but she hates his favorite thing in the world, oden. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パパのボーナス どこいった?
Where Did Papa`s Bonus Go?
episode.summary: When Dad loses his bonus, suspicion quickly falls on Iyami, who`s actually turned over a new leaf. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゾロゾロ 六つ子が一ダース!
Sextuplets Squared!
episode.summary: Osomatsu unwittingly makes a duplicate of himself in Dr. Iyami`s three-dimensional copy machine. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ちびざるチビ太の 大冒険!
Munchkin Monkey Chibita`s Big Adventure!
episode.summary: The powerful, rambunctious Chibita Songoku is imprisoned under a rock for 500 years before being rescued by an ambitious monk, Iyami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トト子の わがままオシャカ様
Totoko, the Selfish Buddha!
episode.summary: Iyami seeks to steal Totoko Buddha`s sutras so he can kickstart his own religion, but they`re alread held as collateral by moneylender and Chibita`s former master, Hatabou. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの 教師ビンビン物語!?
Iyami the Teacher`s Throbbing Story!
episode.summary: Nasty teacher Iyami is tormented by Chibita, the one student who dotes on him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太の 王子様はつらいよ
Life is Tough for Prince Chibita!
episode.summary: Stifled by his royal burdens and constant handlers, Prince Chibiru slips the leash and finds action in a local department store as he gives chase to a pickpocket, Iyami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの インチキ海の家!
Iyami`s Fishy Beach House!
episode.summary: Dad and the boys think they`re getting a good deal by hanging out at Iyami`s Beach House, but the owner and his assistant, Chibita, gouge their guests for everything they`re worth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 魔法を使って 若がえるザンス
Using Magic to Become Younger-zansu.
episode.summary: Mom and Dad get to start their lives over again thanks to a magic wish that reverts them to teenagers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボクシングって 痛いザンス!
Boxing Hurts-zansu!
episode.summary: Oden stand owner Chibita trains to fight the Akatsukadai boxing champion, Iyami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: みつばちチビ太の バイオリン
Honeybee Chibita`s Violin.
episode.summary: Honeybee Chibita is in search of his long-lost mother, but his quest is impeded by a trickster, Iyami Katydid, and the ravenous Dayon Spider. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: トトコは 天才なぞなぞ少女!
Totoko, the Riddling Genius!
episode.summary: Ridde Temple Master Dekapan gives monks Iyami and Chibita the challenge of stumping locals with riddles. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 探偵イヤミ対 怪人ダヨン面相
Detective Iyami versus Phantom Thief Dayon!
episode.summary: Inspector Chibita teams up with "great detective" Iyami to capture Phantom Thief Dayon. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 四十年後の イヤミザンス!
Iyami, 40 Years Later-zansu!
episode.summary: 30 years later, Osomatsu and his brothers are middle-aged salarymen scientists slaving away under their boss, Dekapan, and his demanding daughter, Totoko. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カメラの前で べろ~んザンス
Deformed in Front of the Camera-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami is driven mad by the desperate measures he takes to sell lousy camera film for his failing company. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おそうじロボの ソージ君ダス
Cleany-kun, the Cleaning Robot!
episode.summary: Dekapan invents an artificially intelligent vaccum cleaner that goes out of control and threatens to destroy the country. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 神さまお願い きいてチョ
God, Make My Wish Come True!
episode.summary: God (Dekapan) grants Chibita the power to make all of his wishes come true. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チビ太の まぶたの母ザンス
The Mother in Chibita`s Imagination.
episode.summary: Chibita`s mother comes back into his life by having him kidnapped away from Dekapan, the poor man who raised him. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの 冬ごもり作戦ザンス
Iyami`s Hibernation Strategy-zansu.
episode.summary: With winter on its way, Iyami wants to be jailed for the sake of shelter and warm meals, but all of his attempted crimes turn into good deeds. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニセ医者で ぼろもうけザンス
Raking It In As a Quack!
episode.summary: Would-be burglar Iyami is drafted into posing as the director of a hospital, a ruse that works until he`s forced to treat a yakuza boss. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怖い夢は 見たくないザンス!
I Don`t Want Nightmares-zansu!
episode.summary: Iyami is haunted in his dreams by the spirit of a vengeful samurai, Chibita. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怒ると怖い ライオンザンス!
Lions Are Scary When Angry-zansu!
episode.summary: When Iyami`s circus goes out of business, he gives the lion to the Matsuno family, which doesn`t sit well with Chibita, the lion`s only friend. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハタ坊の 水戸黄門だジョー
Hatabou in Mito Koumon!
episode.summary: In ancient Japan, secret retired vice-shogun Hatabou and his companions go up against crooked magistrate Iyami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: また来たザンスよ エイリアン
The Aliens Have Come Again!
episode.summary: To prepare for invading Earth, aliens abduct Iyami and sift through memories of his worst moments. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イヤミの 選挙必勝法ザンス
Iyami`s Surefire Election Strategy-zansu!
episode.summary: In the final episode, when everyone wants to beat up Iyami and Chibita, it seems their only escape is a long swim across the Pacific. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あっぱれチビ太の鬼たいじザンス
Special
Appare! Chibita no Onitaiji zansu
母さんは 天才セールスマン!?
Mom`s a Born Saleswoman?!
episode.summary: It`s a war between the parents when Dad becomes frustrated that Mom is a better salesperson than he is. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Ending
Opening
